Title: Woody Woodpecker Goes to Camp
Screenplay by: Cory Edwards Jim Martin Stephen Mazur
Based on: Woody Woodpecker by  Universal Pictures  &  Walter Lantz
Starring: Eric Bauza Kevin Michael Richardson Tom Kenny Mary-Louise Parker Josh Lawson
Plot: After getting kicked out of the forest for tormenting a camper until he can redeem himself, Woody thinks he can redeem himself by learing about teamwork in the nearly Camp Woo Hoo — but after arriving, an escaped convict named Buzz Buzzard arrives shortly and then poses as the rival camp's chef to rob a hidden treasure. After Woody arrives, he befriends the camp director's daughter, Maggie, and causes chaos at the camp but after Buzz's failed attempts to destroy the camp and after Woody gets to know the campers and helps the campers train for an annual camp game event known as the Wilderness Games, he gets framed for causing chaos again after meeting and fighting Buzz. An inspector arrives and threatens to shut down the camp. Fortunately, Woody convinces the inspector to give the camp one chance by letting them participate in the Wilderness Games.
Cast: Kevin Michael Richardson as Buzz Buzzard
Chloe De Los Santos as Maggie
Production: In 2021, Universal Pictures and Universal 1440 Entertainment announced a sequel to the 2017 Woody Woodpecker movie. The film was shot in Melbourne and across regional areas of Victoria from September to December 2021.
In February 2024, it was announced that the film would be released on Netflix on April 12, 2024.
